archimate:BusinessRole.name: Crisis Manager
archimate:BusinessRole.documentation:
Crisis Manager (CM) is the head of Crisis Management Team (CMT). This role is mandatory. Person nominated in this role must have position in organization at Business level with mandate to make Business level decisions. Deputy must be nominated for this role.
Key authorities
Makes decision starting the Crisis Management Process. Decides constitution of the Crisis Management Team Makes decision of risk prioritization. Makes decision on Business level. Agrees the task force team for recovery. Makes decision activating the Contingency Plan(s). Makes decision activating the Recovery Teams and Recovery Plan(s). Makes decisions when situation can be normalized. Makes decision which normal operation process will complete the change actions if those have not been fully completed during recovery. Makes decision of closing the Crisis Management Process. Makes decision of the member(s) taking care of the lessons learned and after-action review procedures. ï»¿ Key responsibilities
Decides CMT meeting intervals and times. Decides reporting intervals and recipients of the reports. Decides of reporting content (confidentiality). Crisis Manager evaluates the incident with the Record Keeper if it must be escalated and crisis process must be activated Crisis Manager asks MIM to arrange first meeting. Crisis Manager asks Record Keeper to arrange recurring meetings and needed documentation sharing for team members and for other stake holders. Leads the Unit or Country level crisis based on situation reports and recovery actions. Takes care that all Crisis Management Team members or their deputies are present in the meetings Takes care that all relevant supporting team representatives are available for the team. Criteria and checklists to be used during evaluation.
